name: Ohm
tagline: A library and language for building parsers, interpreters, compilers, etc.
body:
### About

Ohm is a parser generator consisting of a library and a domain-specific language.
You can use it to parse custom file formats or quickly build parsers, interpreters, and compilers for programming languages. The _Ohm language_ is based on [parsing expression grammars](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parsing_expression_grammar)
(PEGs), which are a formal way of describing syntax, similar to regular expressions and context-free
grammars. The _Ohm library_ provides a JavaScript interface (known as Ohm/JS) for creating parsers,
interpreters, and more from the grammars you write.

For more information, see the [GitHub project](https://github.com/cdglabs/ohm).

### Links

* Try out Ohm in the [online editor](https://ohmlang.github.io/editor/)
* [Documentation](https://github.com/cdglabs/ohm/blob/master/doc/README.md)

### Publications

* [Modular Semantic Actions](https://ohmlang.github.io/pubs/dls2016/modular-semantic-actions.pdf) - to appear at [DLS'16](http://conf.researchr.org/track/dls-2016/dls-2016-papers)
* [Language Hacking in a Live Programming Environment](https://ohmlang.github.io/pubs/live2016/) - presented at [LIVE 2016](http://2016.ecoop.org/track/LIVE-2016)
